com.jbirdvegas.mgerrit.database

Class DatabaseFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.ContentProvider
      • com.jbirdvegas.mgerrit.database.DatabaseFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class DatabaseFactory
extends android.content.ContentProvider
    This class aims to manage and abstract which database is being accessed. This is a singleton class, we can have only one DBHelper (it is also a singleton) and we only need one instance of a wdb as we should only have one database file open at a time.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • closeDatabase

        public void closeDatabase()
        Close the current database. We can always check if the database is open by looking for one of the results of this method (e.g. dbHelper == null)

      • insert

        public boolean insert(String table,
             android.content.ContentValues values,
             Integer conflictAlgorithm,
             boolean updateOnDuplicate)
        Insert method where the table has already been defined.
        Parameters:
        table - the table to insert the row into
        values - A set of column_name/value pairs to add to the database. This must not be null.
        conflictAlgorithm - for insert conflict resolver
        updateOnDuplicate -
        Returns:
        Whether the database table changed as a result of the insertion
